name: stirabout
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of porridge (= a thick, soft food) made from oatmeal (= rough flour made from oats) or other grains, boiled in milk or water and eaten hot for breakfast: Stirabout was always a popular food in Ireland. Poor people made their stirabout with buttermilk or water.
More examplesFewer examplesMy brother and I were told not to tell people that we were given stirabout to eat as it was a sign of real poverty.Stirabout is considered wholesome food, but they have not been able to get it.
